label: Verb Noun Mapping
description: A type of SKL Mapping that specifies what should be done when a specific Verb is executed with a specific `noun` as an argument. The Mapping can either have a `verbMapping` to specify a target Verb to execute, or a `returnValueMapping` to directly translate the parameters of the original Verb into the desired return value. When a `verbMapping` is provided, a `parameterMapping` and `parameterMappingFrame` may be provided to translate the parameters of the original Verb into the expected format of the target Verb.

shacl:property.name: verb
shacl:property.shacl:description: The Verb that the Mapping translates from.

shacl:property.name: noun
shacl:property.shacl:description: The Noun that the Mapping uses to determine what action should be taken.

shacl:property.name: parameterMapping
shacl:property.shacl:description: An RML TriplesMap specifying how the standard parameters of the original Verb should be translated into the parameters of the target Verb. This field only gets used if `verbMapping` is also present.

shacl:property.name: parameterMappingFrame
shacl:property.shacl:description: A JSON-LD Frame used to transform the JSON-LD returned by the parameterMapping into the format required by target Verb's parameters. This field only gets used if `verbMapping` and `parameterMapping` are also present.

shacl:property.name: verbMapping
shacl:property.shacl:description: An RML TriplesMap specifying what target Verb should be executed depending on the parameters supplied to the original Verb.

shacl:property.name: returnValueMapping
shacl:property.shacl:description: An RML TriplesMap specifying how the parameters of the Verb should be directly translated into a return value. If `returnValueMapping` is set, there should be no `verbMapping`, `parameterMapping`, or `parameterMappingFrame`.

shacl:property.name: returnValueFrame
shacl:property.shacl:description: A JSON-LD Frame used to transform the JSON-LD returned by the `returnValueMapping` into a prefered format. This field overrides the `returnValueFrame` of the Verb. If not supplied, the Verb's `returnValueFrame` will be used instead.
